result.execSummary:
The defendant Lonza S. Caudill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Submit DNA sample within 30 days and pay surcharge 
Maintain absolute sobriety
Random drug and alcohol screens as recommended by Agent
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent 
Cash bond applied; remaining costs to be paid through Probation. Defendant to contact Probation by 4pm today

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lonza S. Caudill

records.addlTxt: with Withdraw as Counsel - Atty Watts
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

2:57 PM Defendant Lonza S. Caudill appeared by video.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts in court for Lonza S. Caudill. 
Atty Watts is prepared to proceed. Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Juech states plea agreement to Count 6.  Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7 & 8 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Watts agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Atty Watts enters a No Contest plea.  Defendant agrees.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 6 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7 & 8 to be dismissed and read-in

Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Watts makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Count 6:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Maintain Absolute Sobriety
Random drug and alcohol screens as recommended by the Agent
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
$100 cash bond to be applied

Remaining Costs & surcharges to be paid through Probation
Defendant is to contact the Probation office in Portage, WI by 4:00pm today 

Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7 & 8 to be dismissed and read-in
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3/10/22: Bond amended from $500 cash to $100 cash.  
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol

01:36 PM Defendant Lonza S. Caudill appeared by video means (in custody). Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Saralinda R Watts in court for Defendant Lonza S. Caudill.
  Atty Watts and defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Atty Watts requests preliminary hearing be scheduled.  Does not waive time limits.  Requests bond modification.  Atty Burdon objects to any amendment.
BY THE COURT:  Court will modify the bond from $500 cash to $100 cash with same conditions.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Demand for Discovery & Inspection and Motion for Time to File Additional Pretrial Motions
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol

03:25 PM Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lonza S. Caudill appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and states that she did call the Public Defender's office and was told that someone would be appearing with her today.  Defendant wants an Attorney.

Court signed a probable cause statement over the weekend.  

Atty Juech requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant asks for a signature bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions:
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol  Initial appearance scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
